thread.title: Falcons fly away with win over Cats
thread.title_full: Falcons fly away with win over Cats

author:
Debbie Holmes 

Trail-Gazette
title: Falcons fly away with win over Cats
text:
Falcons fly away with win over Cats By Debbie Holmes Posted: 10/14/2015 09:09:50 AM MDT Click photo to enlarge Estes Park senior Sam Addison sprints for the end zone during Friday's homecoming game against Front Range Christian. The Cats suffered a 20-14 defeat. « 1 » 
Front Range Christian came to give the Bobcats a real duel for their homecoming game Friday night under the lights. 
The Falcons carried away the win, 20-14, following a battle that was balanced on both sides of the field for most of the game. 
Front Range scored first booting two field goals through the uprights after the Cats defense stopped their progress down the field early in the first and second quarters of the game. Senior Sam Addison tied the ball game at six when he ran in for a Cat touchdown right before halftime. 
The Falcons dominated the third quarter scoring their final two touchdowns of the game giving them the 20-6 lead. 
Estes took control of the forth quarter, stopping any further Falcon scoring and adding eight points to their score. Joseph Coleson grabbed a pass from Jordan Duemig and ran in for a second touchdown, followed by a 2-point conversion on a short pass to Addison. 
The Cats will travel to face Clear Creek 7 p.m. this Friday, Oct. 16. Advertisement
